data.title: Most violent shonen manga you've read?
data.meta_description: Mine might surprise some of you (specifically those of you who have seen the 4kids anime) but it's Yu-Gi-Oh! It has shit like a guy SKINNING HIS OWN FATHER...
data.text:
Mine might surprise some of you (specifically those of you who have seen the 4kids anime) but it's Yu-Gi-Oh! It has shit like a guy SKINNING HIS OWN FATHER ALIVE. Even the Japanese version of the anime had to tone things down. It's definitely more violent than the likes of Naruto/One Piece, which is quite an accomplishment considering yugioh is a manga about card games and Naruto and One Piece are action manga.

The Tommyrod vs. Toriko fight in Toriko is pretty brutal for a shonen series.

Jojos Bizarre Adventure though takes the cake. Don't know how it got away with some of the stuff it did. It's not just blood, but really gross imagery like nails and skin being pulled off.

Just a few minor examples

Haikyuu

Haikyuu

Haikyuu

Akame ga Kill and Deadman Wonderland are seinen.

No they aren't.

They run in shonen magazines, therefore they are shonen.

Anyways, my answer is JoJo or Hunter x Hunter for modern shonen manga.

I don't think Yu-Gi-Oh! is the most violent Shonen Manga/Anime. I mean there are parts where it gets really dark.

But it is cool to have more YGO fans.

Akame ga Kill!, Hunter x Hunter, Shingeki no Kyojin, Embalming (from what I remember, its been a while), and Mahou Shoujo of the End. There might be a few more that I'm missing but those are the ones that immediately spring to mind for me.

I don't think anything could topple violence jack.

How in the fuck was that shounen anyway? Idk.

Im googleing the titles mentioned here for images, and jesus, thats some berserk level of fucked up..

JJBA, Fist of The North Star, and Bastard!! are pretty fucking violent for shonen.

I was gonna say Bastard!!, main character had his body destroyed and was reduced to a head and spinal column for an entire volume from what I remember.

Fist of the North Star with all its creative and brutal deaths.

I don't think anything could topple violence jack.

How in the fuck was that shounen anyway? Idk.

wtf

Just skimming through the 1st chapter, you have brutal deaths, decapitations, intestines, nudes, a trap who got raped, a tiger tongue that suddenly shape into a dick, gangrapes and tortures.

I knew that back in the day shonen were pretty hardcore, but wow

It is. From the author of Devilman

It was literally his next manga after Devilman, published in the same magazine - weekly shounen magazine.

Fun fact, he's also the guy who created the mecha genre as we know it with Mazinger.

Good times they had.
